synopsis.text:
So ared into the spotlight as one of Japan's most cherished television personalities, Tetsuko Kuroyanagi, fondly known as Totto-chan, shares her enchanting childhood memories of attending the unconventional Tomoe Gakuen Primary School during the turmoil of World War II. Expelled from her previous public school, Totto-chan's life takes a turn for the better when her mother enrolls her in this unique institution, where old railroad cars serve as classrooms, and the extraordinary headmaster, Sosaku Kobayashi, champions freedom of expression and creativity.

As Totto-chan learns to navigate her new surroundings, she discovers the true meaning of friendship, love, and the grim realities of war. With the backdrop of global conflict, the Tomoe School imparts valuable lessons on racism and intolerance, allowing Totto-chan to grow and flourish under the guidance of the visionary headmaster.

This heartwarming tale of a young girl's journey through an unforgettable educational experience has captured the hearts of millions, becoming a runaway bestseller in Japan. Delve into the magical world of Totto-chan's adventures and witness how her time at Tomoe School shaped her into the remarkable woman she is today.
